column1: One fine summer day a very hungry fox sallied out in search of his dinner. After a while his eye rested on a young rooster
column2: which he thought would make a very good meal: so he lay down under a wall and hid himself in the high grass
column3: intending to wait until the rooster got near enough
column4: and then to spring on him
column7: the rooster saw him and flew
column9: to the top of the wall.The fox could not get him there
column10: and he knew it: so he came out from his hiding-place
column11: and addressed the rooster thus: "Dear me!" he cried
column12: "how handsomely you are dressed! I came to invite your magnificence to a grand christening feast. The duck and the goose have promised to come
